action.action-desc: Mr. Peters of California introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Small Business

form.official-title: To direct the Administrator of the Small Business Administration and the Administrator of General Services to make rules to streamline and simplify the registration system used by small business concerns, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Open Government Technology Work to More Businesses Act.

section.header: Regulations for business registration system to be considered for Federal contract

subsection.text: Not later than 6 months after the date of enactment of this Act, the Administrator of the Small Business Administration and the Administrator of General Services shall jointly make rulesâ€”

paragraph.text: to streamline and simplify the registration system used by small business concerns to be considered for an award of any Federal contract;
that establish procedures by which a small business concern may self-certify its eligibility for a Federal contract under section 8 of the Small Business Act (15 U.S.C. 637); and
that establish procedures by which a majority of small business concerns may complete the registration process not later than 4 weeks after beginning such process.

subsection.text: Not later than 12 months after the date of enactment of this Act, the Administrator of the Small Business Administration and the Administrator of General Services shall make the registration system described in subsection (a)(1) available in a unified electronic format accessible through the Internet.
